title: 關聖帝君一百籤第八十九籤
subtitle: 班超歸玉門關壬壬

analysis.zh: 這首詩的主題是時間與機遇的關係，提醒詩人當下無事可慮，應以樂觀姿態面對，等到適時機會到來時，仍能獲得成就。詩句暗示：白馬渡江象徵前進的勢頭，虎頭城裡看巍峨則表示在重要時刻展現英勇。
analysis.en: This poem focuses on the relationship between time and opportunity. It advises the reader that when circumstances are calm, one should embrace a relaxed, cheerful attitude and not fret. When the right moment arrives, the speaker will cross the river on a white horse and stand proudly in the Tiger‑Head City, symbolizing eventual success and the fulfillment of ambitions.
analysis.jp: この詩は時間と運気の関係をテーマにしています。現状が穏やかであれば、落ち着いて高らかに歌い、無理に心配する必要はありません。適切な時が来れば、白馬で川を渡り、虎頭城で堂々と立つことを示し、遅れた成就や成功を暗示しています。
analysis.reference: 漢。班超。安陵人。彪之子。少有大志。家貧。傭書養母。嘗投筆歎曰。大丈當立功異域。以取封侯。安能久事筆硯乎。明章兩朝征定五十餘國。封定遠侯。久鎮西域後。年老乞歸。帝便任尚代之。故超得歸入玉門關。至京未幾而卒。

rag_analysis:
According to the poem, the core meaning is:
- The present situation is calm and free of urgent matters.
- One should enjoy life and sing rather than worry.
- The right time will eventually come.
- When it does, a ‘white horse’ will cross the river, symbolising forward momentum.
- In the ‘Tiger‑Head City’ one will look grand and resolute, indicating a bold stance at a critical moment.
- Overall, the poem conveys a message of late blooming and eventual achievement, urging patience and a positive outlook.
